name: Physical Chemistry
long_desc: This is a onesemester course intended primarily for students majoring in Biological Sciences, students pursuing a B.A. degree program in Chemistry, and students in the B.S.A.program with a concentration in chemistry. The course focuses on thermodynamics, transport and reaction rates and their application to chemical and biological systems. Emphasis is given to attaining a good fundamental understanding of entropy and free energy. This is more a concepts than skills building course. Topics include applications of thermodynamics to chemical and biochemical equilibria, electrochemistry, solutions, and chemical kinetics. 3 hrs. lec.

custom_fields.goals: Upon successful completion of this class, you should be able toExplain the differences between ideal versus real gases Define common thermodynamic terms such as enthalpy, entropy, free energy, internal energy, etc. in ways that connect them to molecular and systemlevel conceptsUtilize standard enthalpies of formation or bond energies to evaluate or estimate reaction enthalpiesProvide concise statements of the four laws of thermodynamicsDescribe important bonding and noncovalent interactions in terms of electrostatics and relative strengthDefine reduction and oxidation and associated properties such as electrode potentialsDefine acids and bases and associated properties such as pKaExplain why reaction rates are not always determined by overall thermochemistry
custom_fields.key_topics:
Gases
Laws of thermodynamics
Solutions
Chemical Equilibriua
Electrochemistry
Acids and Bases
Chemical Kinetics
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge:
09-106: Modern Chemistry II
21-122: Integration, Differential Equations, and Approximation
33-121: Physics I for Science Students
custom_fields.relevance:
This is a one-semester course intended primarily for students pursuing a B.A. degree program
in Chemistry, students in cross-disciplinary programs with a concentration in chemistry, and
perhaps students majoring in Biological Sciences. IT also fulfills the inorganic/ physical chemistry course requirement for the minor in chemistry.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: At the discretion of the instructor upon consultation with the class, an optional 50-minute recitation may be scheduled after the start of classes.
